page.title: 13Events
page.content: {Storth}is a lively village community with a number of annual events. In June there is a village fete with stalls, displays, fun sports and a Gala Queen. An annual Horticultural Show is held in the village hall, with cups and prizes given for various classes, including homegrown fruit and vegetables, and handicrafts. The estuary provides its own events. High tides cut off the road along the promenade causing motorists long diversions or even longer waits. Locals watch to see if any will be unwise enough to attempt to make it through the floods, and to render assistance to those stranded by their own impatience. Extreme cold in winter produces spectacular iceflows sailing majestically down the estuary. February 1985 provided some of the best for many years.
